data.api_key: API Key (leave blank if not required)

data_description.base_url: Fully-qualified URL pointing to your server's API root. Typically ends with /v1.
data_description.api_key: Required by some hosted services. Local servers (LM Studio, Ollama) generally do not need one.
data_description.use_lmstudio_api: When enabled, requests are sent to LM Studio's native /api/v1/chat endpoint instead of the OpenAI-compatible endpoint. This allows LM Studio to orchestrate MCP tool calls end-to-end.

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the LLM server. Check that the URL is correct and the server is running.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Check the logs for details.

abort.already_configured: A server with this URL is already configured.

user.title: Configure Conversation Agent
user.description: Choose a model and configure this LLM-powered conversation agent.

data.context_length: Context Length (tokens, LM Studio native mode)

data_description.model: Model to use for completions. The list is fetched live from your server.
data_description.llm_hass_api: Grant the agent access to Home Assistant's built-in tool APIs so it can control lights, switches, and other entities.
data_description.temperature: Sampling temperature. Lower = more deterministic, higher = more creative.
data_description.context_length: Only used in LM Studio Native API mode.
data_description.max_message_history: Limits how many previous conversation rounds are sent to the model to stay within its context window.
data_description.mcp_servers: Add MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers to extend the agent with external tools. Each entry requires at minimum a 'type' field.

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the server to retrieve the model list.
